newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine state bank sale just matter of time.
newsitem.headline: Argentine state bank sale just matter of time.

text.p: The president of Argentina's state-owned mortgage bank Banco Hipotecario Nacional said Monday the privatization of the institution is the only way to obtain capital to sustain the bank's role in increasing construction in the country.
"The key to the debate is not whether to privatize the bank, but the convenience of doing it today or tomorrow," said Pablo Rojo, the bank's president, according to state-owned news agency Telam.

At the end of September Argentina's government announced it would sell 90 percent of its holdings in Banco Hipotecario. The first tranch of shares, between 20 and 30 percent of the state's stake will be sold in the middle of next year.

Rojo estimated between $2 to $2.5 billion will be made from the sale. When this amount is invested, there will be an income of between $300 million and $400 million yearly that can be dedicated to provincial infrastructure projects that the state will not be able to finance.
